level 1.Description: Gender-sensitive electrification planning implements building standards that promote gender equality in energy access and usage.
Gender-sensitive electrification planning funds renewable energy projects that aim to provide clean and sustainable energy to communities.
Gender-sensitive electrification planning focuses on improving energy access for marginalized and underserved communities, particularly women and girls.
Gender-sensitive electrification planning is implemented in rural areas to address the energy needs of rural communities, with a focus on gender equality.
Gender-sensitive electrification planning partners with local NGOs to ensure community engagement and participation in energy planning and implementation.
Gender-sensitive electrification planning contributes to the achievement of Sustainable Development Goals, particularly Goal 7: Affordable and Clean Energy.
Gender-sensitive electrification planning monitors energy consumption patterns to identify areas for improvement and optimize energy efficiency.
Gender-sensitive electrification planning targets the reduction of energy poverty by ensuring equitable access to affordable and reliable energy services.

level 2.Subject: energy markets
level 2.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

level 2.Subject: energy markets
level 2.Description: Energy markets employ renewable energy technologies to diversify the energy mix and reduce dependence on fossil fuels.

level 2.Subject: energy poverty indices
level 2.Description: Energy poverty indices implement energy access programs to provide affordable and reliable energy services to underserved communities.

level 2.Description: Energy poverty indices fund renewable energy projects to increase access to clean and sustainable energy sources.
